dublin_core.dcvalue: Telerobotic surgery is ideally suited for remote applications in which the instrument control console is stationed separately from the end effectors at the patient s bedside However if the distance between the console and the patient is great enough a lag effect or latency between end effector manipulation and the depicted image leads to alterations in movement patterns The purpose of this study was to determine the effect of visual delay on surgical task performance
The effect of delayed visual feedback on telerobotic surgery.
